note_tweet.text:
The problem right now is all the incentives are backwards for Palestinian leadership. They get rewarded by perpetuating war instead of seeking peace. What people refuse to acknowledge is that the main impediment to peace since 1947 has been the unwillingness of the Palestinian Arabs to accept a Jewish state in the area. They could have had a state repeatedly for over 75 years if they could have just accepted that reality. Instead they have only supported violence, which has gotten Palestinians one loss after the next and permanent refugee status without them recognizing the inevitability of the outcome. Although their leadership has gotten incredibly rich from that cycle.

The continued evidence that they will not accept the Jewish state only works against them. Their open support for Israel's destruction and continued war makes it impossible for Israel to accept an autonomous Palestinian state on their border from which those same Palestinians will continue to wage war. No one is going to reward 10/7 with greater concessions to Palestinians. That's not the lesson anyone in Israel is taking away. People elsewhere can whine about it all they want, but it's not their children who will be targeted for death as a result.

There is no path to peace, and certainly not 2 states, until Palestinians get leadership that openly tells their people that they must accept Israel's existence and violence won't change the reality of such a state. Not just in false sense of signing a piece of paper while planning more attacks, but really tell that to Palestinians. That won't happen until others force Palestinian leaders to take accountability for their actions instead of just treating them like victims with no agency. As long as they get rewarded for perpetuating the war, they will continue to do so and those encouraging it are complicit in a lack of resolution.

note_tweet.text:
I was just about to post about him when this sad news came out.

Joshua Mollel, one of two Tanzanians taken hostage by Hamas, has been murdered by Hamas terrorists.

Joshua arrived in Israel just a couple of weeks before the October 7 attacks to study agriculture.

Loitu Mollel, Joshua's father, gave a heartbreaking interview to the BBC in October, sharing that he wasn't sleeping or eating to the point where people at his local market noticed how thin he had become.

Joshua's first trip out of Tanzania was his flight to Israel in September.

Joshua's father (photo on the right) said the last time he spoke to his son was on October 5, telling him, "Be on your best behavior because you're somewhere new, and make the most of the internship you're there to do."

Joshua’s father said that his son’s dream was to return to Tanzania after studying in Israel and become one of the most successful farmers in Tanzania. 

Joshua is the second Tanzanian citizen to be murdered by Hamas; the other is Clemence Felix Mtenga. Clemence’s family was notified in November that he had been murdered.

note_tweet.text:
Eynav Levy 🕯️

Eynav was murdered by Hamas at the Supernova music festival on October 7. Her husband, Or, was taken hostage in Gaza.

Their two-year-old son has been alternating between living with his two sets of grandparents ever since. “He is calling out for his mom and dad all the time,” said Or’s brother.

The couple arrived at the festival just before the attack began. They sought refuge in a roadside bomb shelter, last speaking to their family at 7:39 a.m.

Several days later, the IDF informed the family that Eynav’s body had been found in the shelter and that Or had been taken captive.

May Eynav's memory forever be a blessing.

note_tweet.text:
The dead body of a kidnapped Israeli woman has been found by IDF forces in a tunnel in Gaza. 

Eden Zechariah, 28, was kidnapped from the Nova festival after being shot in her upper body on Oct 7th and held hostage by Hamas ever since. 

Her boyfriend, Ofek Kimchi, was killed trying to shield her before she was dragged off to Gaza alive. 

Two IDF soldiers died in the effort to recover her body. 

They are named as Master-Sgt. (res.) Gal Meir Eisenkot and Master-Sgt. (res.) Eyal Meir Berkovich. 

Additionally, the body of IDF Warrant Officer Ziv Dado, who was also kidnapped on Oct 7th was also recovered, hidden in a tunnel. 

Source: Jerusalem Post

note_tweet.text:
Etay Perry fell in battle in Gaza. Excerpts from his heartbroken widow, Hila, who struggles to say goodbye:

I love you so much that words cannot describe. I am so sad that my body cannot contain the sorrow.

I want to tell you that I will be strong and I will overcome and take care of the children, but the truth is, right now I don't know how I will do it.

I want to tell you that you got to see our three amazing children and thank you for the gifts you left me. But God, they are so small you haven't seen them grow yet.

I want to tell you that we had a full and perfect life and everything was so good. But it was so, so short.

I want to tell you that we took advantage of every moment, but you were taken from us in your last two months.

I want to tell you that you are a hero, but you didn't want to be a hero. You just wanted your life back.

I didn't allow myself to be afraid, that maybe you really are not in a dangerous place like you said, I didn't allow myself to think that there was a chance that you wouldn't come back. 

We promised the children! You promised to be at Ido's second grade Hanukkah party. He is still waiting for you to come back and we will celebrate his birthday together!

Ido continues to ask that we look for a cure. It was difficult for him, but in the end he said that you are in our hearts, and that in the future we can be as happy as before you left.

This is the worst possible ending. I don't know how to continue from here. So even though right now it seems impossible to me, I promise to do everything everything to keep, protect and love the children from your heart as well.

On… https://t.co/r3GIIf5SwA https://t.co/94ts0vCbxk

note_tweet.text:
Nashville: After a juvenile told his Muslim family that he had converted to Christianity, his mother, father, and brother attacked him.

The victim told police officers that his family repeatedly punched him and spat in his face. His mother then took a knife and scratched the back of his right hand with it. Throughout the assault, his family kept demanding that he denounce Christianity and say that he is Muslim. 

Police described the juvenile as “cut haphazardly” with lumps on his face. He was “trembling and wide eyed” with “disheveled” hair. The boy was transported to a local hospital for treatment, arrest records state.

The victim said the assault continued until law enforcement arrived at the home.

https://t.co/1dsQpoR0KD
